jparsec.astrophysics.gildas

Class ProcessSpectrum

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.gildas.ProcessSpectrum

  • public class ProcessSpectrum
extends java.lang.Object
    Spectrum reduction. This class contains methods to process a given spectrum and return a set of Gaussians. There are also general methods called 'reduceSpectrum' that performs the reduction process in a fully automatic way. This class can be used in a static way to quickly reduce a spectrum or with an instance in case more control of the reduction process is desired.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Field Detail

      • v

        public double[] v
        The array of processed spectrum in a given moment, observations at startup and reduced at the end.

      • minimumValueToConsiderBadChannel

        public static double minimumValueToConsiderBadChannel
        Minimum value to consider a given channel to be possibly a bad channel. Default value is -100, which means that bad channels should have intensities below this value.

      • IMPOSSIBLE_MOLECULES

        public static java.lang.String IMPOSSIBLE_MOLECULES
        List of impossible molecules (those will never be found in astronomy), empty by default. Note you should insert the list separated by comma, with the exact name you will find in JPL and/or COLOGNE catalogs. These molecules will be skipped when identifying lines with identifyLine(double, double, double, double, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean).

      • TIMES_SIGMA

        public static double TIMES_SIGMA
        The sigma factor, 3.0 by default.

      • maximumNumberOfIterationsForNelderAndMeadSimplexInRegressionClass

        public static int maximumNumberOfIterationsForNelderAndMeadSimplexInRegressionClass
        Sets the maximum number of iterations when computing fitting Gaussians. Default value is 3000, but could be too high. Internally the method Regression.setMaximumNumberOfInterationsForNelderAndMeadSimplex(int) is called with this value.

      • getSigma

        public static double getSigma(double[] v)
        Returns the mean deviation of the spectrum in the input array.
        Parameters:
        v - Input spectrum.
        Returns:
        The mean deaviation, defined as the square root of the squares of the differences between each point and the arithmetic mean value, divided by the number of points, all inside the square root..

      • removeLine

        public void removeLine(SpectrumLine line)

      • clipLines

        public void clipLines(SpectrumLine[] line)
               throws JPARSECException
        Clips a set of lines in the reduced spectrum of this instance. The clipping is done between the minimum and maximum channels for the lines as given in the line object, or computed from the position and width in case previous values are 0. An intensity is computed from a smoothed spectrum before and after each line, and then the intensity within the line is set to a linear interpolation between both values.
        Parameters:
        line - The set of lines to clip.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • removeLine

        public void removeLine(double[] v,
              double[] g,
              double t)
        Removes a line from a spectrum, only near its peak.
        Parameters:
        v - Input/output spectrum as an array.
        g - Parameters of the Gaussian.
        t - Number of time the width of the line is considered to remove the spectrum data around.

      • fitLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[]> fitLines(boolean eliminateNoise)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Fits the lines in a spectrum. The spectrum should be previously reduced. The method getLines(ArrayList) can later be used to return a set of SpectrumLine objects with the fitted lines.
        Parameters:
        eliminateNoise - True to substract the residual spectrum to the processed spectrum.
        Returns:
        A list with the parameters of the Gaussian lines. Each record contains an array with the following values: Gaussian x central position (km/s), Gaussian width (km/s), Gaussian peak (K), Gaussian area (K km/s), and their errors. Additional values given are the minimum channel (at v = v0 - w), the maximum channel value, and the frequency in MHz.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getLines

        public SpectrumLine[] getLines(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> fittedLines)
        Transforms a set of lines fitted (returned as a set of double arrays) to a set of SpectrumLine objects.
        Parameters:
        fittedLines - The lines fitted, returned as arrays of doubles.
        Returns:
        The set of SpectrumLine objects.

      • fitLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[]> fitLines(boolean eliminateNoise,
                                     int maxN)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Fits the lines in a spectrum. The spectrum should be previously reduced. The method getLines(ArrayList) can later be used to return a set of SpectrumLine objects with the fitted lines.
        Parameters:
        eliminateNoise - True to substract the residual spectrum to the processed spectrum.
        maxN - Maximum number of lines to return, -1 to return all of them.
        Returns:
        A list with the parameters of the Gaussian lines. Each record contains an array with the following values: Gaussian x central position (km/s), Gaussian width (km/s), Gaussian peak (K), Gaussian area (K km/s), and their errors. Additional values given are the minimum channel (at v = v0 - w), the maximum channel value, and the frequency in MHz.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fitLineBetweenChannels

        public double[] fitLineBetweenChannels(int c0,
                              int c1,
                              double yMin,
                              double yMax,
                              boolean eliminateLine)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Fits the lines in a spectrum. The spectrum should be previously reduced. Sigma value is obtained automatically. The method getLines(ArrayList) can later be used to return a set of SpectrumLine objects with the fitted lines.
        Parameters:
        c0 - Initial channel.
        c1 - Final channel.
        yMin - Minimum y value. In case some value in the spectrum is below this one, that channel will not be taken into account in the fit.
        yMax - Maximum y value. In case some value in the spectrum is above this one, that channel will not be taken into account in the fit.
        eliminateLine - True to subtract the line to the current spectrum.
        Returns:
        A list with the parameters of the Gaussian lines.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fitLineBetweenChannels

        public double[] fitLineBetweenChannels(double sigma,
                              int c0,
                              int c1,
                              double yMin,
                              double yMax,
                              boolean eliminateLine)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Fits the lines in a spectrum. The spectrum should be previously reduced. The method getLines(ArrayList) can later be used to return a set of SpectrumLine objects with the fitted lines.
        Parameters:
        sigma - The sigma value of the spectrum. This affects the errors of the Gaussian parameters.
        c0 - Initial channel.
        c1 - Final channel.
        yMin - Minimum y value. In case some value in the spectrum is below this one, that channel will not be taken into account in the fit.
        yMax - Maximum y value. In case some value in the spectrum is above this one, that channel will not be taken into account in the fit.
        eliminateLine - True to substract the line to the current spectrum.
        Returns:
        A list with the parameters of the Gaussian lines.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • fixLevel0

        public void fixLevel0()
        Corrects the 'level 0' of the spectrum in case there is a significant amount of continuum. This correction is done automatically.

      • reduceResiduals

        public double[] reduceResiduals(int n,
                       double[] data)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Smoothes the residual spectrum (an invisible array stored internally in this instance) and returns the result of subtracting it to a given input array. This method should be applied to the residuals after the reduction is done. It is not used in this class, it is intended to be used for advanced reduction externally.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of channels to smooth the residual array.
        data - The spectrum array where the smoothed residuals should be reduced.
        Returns:
        The flattened spectrum, input data - smoothed residuals. In case the data array is null the returned array is the smoothed residuals.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • sumSpectra

        public static Spectrum30m sumSpectra(Gildas30m[] f,
                     java.lang.String s,
                     java.lang.String m,
                     double searchOffset1,
                     double searchOffset2,
                     java.lang.String t)
        Sums spectra and returns the mean of them. This method will average all scans with the same rest frequency. This frequency corresponds to the first scan found to satisfy the conditions or parameters set in this method. For a given particular frequency use instead sumSpectra(Gildas30m[], String, String, double, double, String, double).
        Parameters:
        f - Set of 30m files.
        s - The source name to search for.
        m - The molecule to search for.
        searchOffset1 - The RA offset to search for.
        searchOffset2 - The DEC offset to search for.
        t - The telescope to search for.
        Returns:
        The spectrum.

      • sumSpectra

        public static Spectrum30m sumSpectra(Gildas30m[] f,
                     java.lang.String s,
                     java.lang.String m,
                     double searchOffset1,
                     double searchOffset2,
                     java.lang.String t,
                     double restFreq)
        Sums spectra and returns the mean of them.
        Parameters:
        f - Set of 30m files.
        s - The source name to search for.
        m - The molecule to search for.
        searchOffset1 - The RA offset to search for.
        searchOffset2 - The DEC offset to search for.
        t - The telescope to search for.
        restFreq - Rest frequency of the scans to average in MHz. Set to <= 0 to compute it automatically, averaging all spectra for the same frequency as that of the first scan found that satisfies the other conditions.
        Returns:
        The spectrum.

      • clearTransitionsForLineIdentification

        public static void clearTransitionsForLineIdentification()
        Clears all transitions read so that they are forced to be read again for a new set of parameters in the line search process.

      • identifyLine

        public static java.lang.String[] identifyLine(double freq,
                              double width,
                              double maxT,
                              double maxrint,
                              boolean jpl,
                              boolean splatalogue,
                              boolean onlyAtmospheric,
                              boolean onlyPossibleButStrangeLines)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Identify a line given some data. Transitions are stored in memory for the parameters given below, so in case they change the method clearTransitionsForLineIdentification() should be called first. The field IMPOSSIBLE_MOLECULES can optionally be used to insert between commas the names of all molecules you would like to skip when identifying lines.
        Parameters:
        freq - Frequency (approximate) of the line in MHz.
        width - Width of the line in MHz.
        maxT - Maximum temperature of the upper transition. Set to 0 to avoid this condition.
        maxrint - Minimum value of the rint parameter of the transition, which is associated with the intensity of the line. Set to 0 to avoid this condition, required for instance to obtain recombination lines in the output.
        jpl - True for JPL catalog, false for COLOGNE.
        splatalogue - True to call Splatalogue using web service and to return a simple list of species found. Setting this as true will make previous jpl flag useless.
        onlyAtmospheric - Set to true to return only possible atmospheric lines. This is only allowed for splatalogue.
        onlyPossibleButStrangeLines - Set to true to return only possible ISM lines, but less probable. In case onlyAtmospheric is true this flag will be ignored.
        Returns:
        The set of transitions at freqs freq +/- width/2.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • reduceSpectrum

        public void reduceSpectrum(int n,
                  int lineChannelStart,
                  int lineChannelEnd)
        A very simple reduction method that passes a baseline only.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of channels to smooth to reduce a given channel to 0.
        lineChannelStart - Channel number (index) where the line of interest starts. Set to -1 no use no line window.
        lineChannelEnd - Channel number where the line ends. Set to -1 no use no line window.

      • reduceSpectrum

        public static SpectrumLine[] reduceSpectrum(Spectrum spectrum,
                            int maxN)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Reduces the spectrum in a fully automatic way.
        Parameters:
        spectrum - The spectrum.
        maxN - Maximum number of lines to return, -1 to return all of them.
        Returns:
        The set of lines found, or null if none is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • reduceSpectrumAndReturnProcessSpectrum

        public static ProcessSpectrum reduceSpectrumAndReturnProcessSpectrum(Spectrum30m spectrum,
                                                     int maxN)
                                                              throws JPARSECException
        Reduces the spectrum in a fully automatic way and return the process instance.
        Parameters:
        spectrum - The spectrum.
        maxN - Maximum number of lines to return, -1 to return all of them.
        Returns:
        The instance of the processed spectrum. The process will be complete only in case at least one line is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • reduceSpectrumAndReturnProcessSpectrum

        public static ProcessSpectrum reduceSpectrumAndReturnProcessSpectrum(Spectrum30m spectrum)
                                                              throws JPARSECException
        Reduces the spectrum in a fully automatic way and return the process instance.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
